form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Brown introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify and permanently extend qualified zone academy bonds, and to treat such bonds as specified tax credit bonds.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Rebuilding America's Schools Act.

section.header: Enhancement of qualified zone academy bonds

subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of section 54E(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking and $400,000,000 for 2011 and all that follows through the period and inserting the following: $400,000,000 for 2011, 2012, 2013, and 2014, and $1,400,000,000 for each calendar year after 2014..

subsection.header: Construction of a public school facility
subsection.text: Subparagraph (A) of section 54E(d)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking rehabilitating or repairing and inserting constructing, rehabilitating, or repairing.

subsection.header: Adjustment of private business contribution requirement
subsection.text: Subsection (b) of section 54E of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking 10 percent and inserting 5 percent.
Clause (iii) of section 6431(f)(3)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

clause.text: a qualified zone academy bond (as defined in section 54E), or

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to obligations issued after December 31, 2014.
